column1: ap 08:00|"eight o’clock"|"One is reminded also of an earlier piece by Carroll in which he proves that a stopped clock is more accurate than one that loses a minute a day. The first clock is exactly right twice every twenty-four hours
column2: whereas the other clock is exactly right only once in two years. “You might go on to ask
column4: “‘How am I to know when eight o’clock does come? My clock will not tell me.’ Be patient: you know that when eight o’clock comes your clock is right; very good; then your rule is this: keep your eyes fixed on the clock and the very moment it is right it will be eight o’clock.”"|"The Annotated Alice"|"Lewis Carroll"
